response:
Urgent neuroimaging is required to confirm inflammation of the optic nerve and evaluate for disseminated demyelinating plaques in the brain and spine (MS diagnostic criteria). Serological testing is essential to exclude NMO/MOG antibodies and other metabolic or infectious mimics. Visual Evoked Potentials and OCT provide functional and structural quantification of the nerve injury.

investigations = ["MRI Brain and Orbits with Gadolinium", "MRI Cervical and Thoracic Spine", "Optical Coherence Tomography (OCT)", "Visual Evoked Potentials (VEP)", "Full blood count", "Urea and electrolytes", "Liver function tests", "C-reactive protein (CRP)", "Erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR)", "Anti-AQP4 antibodies", "Anti-MOG antibodies", "Vitamin B12 and Folate", "Syphilis serology", "HIV serology", "Autoimmune screen (ANA, ANCA)", "Lumbar Puncture (for oligoclonal bands)"]
